intro: Rubus costaricanus f. longisetosus, commonly known as the long-hairy rasp莓, is a shrub native to Costa Rica. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in Central American ecosystems.
